title: evangelists
comment: Those called by God to announce good news and, especially, to proclaim the good news of Jesus Christ. The work was first committed to the apostles and then to other believers gifted by the Holy Spirit for the task.

children.title: evangelists, identity of
children.comment: Some OT figures announced good news, but most evangelists are seen in the NT. The task was first given by Jesus Christ to the apostles and then to other believers. All Christians have a part in evangelism; there is, too, a special role of evangelist within the church, fulfilled by those with a particular gifting from the Holy Spirit.

children.title: An evangelist as one who announces good news
God as an announcer of good news

primaryrefs.comment: The good news of the end of the Babylonian exile.

seealsos.comment: the good news of the deliverance from Assyria

children.title: John the Baptist announces good news
Jesus Christ sends out the Twelve

seealsos.comment: Peter and John preach the gospel in Samaria
Peter preaches the gospel to Cornelius.

primaryrefs.comment: Timothy's calling includes that of an evangelist.

children.title: evangelists, ministry of
children.comment: Evangelists proclaim the good news of Jesus Christ, calling those who hear to believe in him. This may be in the context of missionary journeys, often in partnership with others, or within a more settled ministry. Carrying out the task requires integrity and commitment in the face of hardships and danger; it also brings joy at seeing the church grow.

children.title: Testifying to the truth about Jesus Christ
Calling people to believe in Jesus Christ
The context of the evangelist's work
Within a settled period of ministry

primaryrefs.comment: Timothy as a pastor is also to do the work of an evangelist.

seealsos.comment: Paul spends a year and a half in Corinth
Paul preaches the gospel whilst under house arrest in Rome

children.title: Working so as not to be a burden
Joy at seeing the church grow
The satisfaction of seeing new converts grow in their faith
